SENT.plain: An 83-year-old man presented with episodes of right sided retro-orbital pain, visual disturbance, involuntary jerks of his left arm and less frequently his left leg
The symptoms could be triggered by exercise, heat or cough
EEG recordings revealed no epileptic discharges
Duplex ultrasonography showed an occlusion of the right internal carotid artery
Blood flow velocity in the right middle cerebral artery was reduced and vasomotor reactivity to hypercapnia was absent
Reduction of his antihypertensive medication rendered the patient asymptomatic
The combination of transient visual blurring, retro-orbital pain and contralateral limb shaking can be an unusual manifestation of carotid occlusive disease
In such a case, the symptoms may be managed successfully by the elevation of blood pressure
